summary: Design and build a complete, motivating, anti-cheating Task Reminder System with smart reminders, completion follow-ups, rewards, gamification, and a distinctly game-like UI/UX (not website-like), delivering full product/UX/design/technical blueprints.
architectural_notes: Scope includes all requested features (no removal/simplification) and should be enhanced beyond the user's initial spec in quality/detail.

UI/UX direction updated: redesign the full interface toward a game-like presentation (quests/avatar/world framing) rather than a website-like layout, using the provided reference design as the visual baseline.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and per-user data isolation so each signed-in user only sees and edits their own tasks, reminders, progress, and rewards.

Create a complete task model and CRUD flows: users can create/edit/archive tasks with title, description, category/tags, priority level, recurrence (daily/weekly/custom days), target time(s), grace period, and an optional estimated duration for timed sessions.

Implement in-app smart reminder scheduling and re-reminders (no push/SMS/email): compute due/overdue tasks on the backend and drive an in-app reminder center that triggers while the app is open via periodic polling and local timers; support escalating re-reminders when a reminder is ignored.

Add completion follow-up flows that require proof of completion: user must submit at least one proof type per completion (text note, checklist confirmation, timed session log, or photo upload) and answer reflection questions after completion; if skipped, automatically offer reschedule options.

Implement a reward economy: XP, coins, levels, streak bonuses, badges, unlockable skins/themes, weekly reward chest, and long-term achievements; make rewards feel immediate and celebratory with micro-animations and optional sound effects.

Add gamification layers: story-mode progression with chapters, avatar growth tied to productivity, daily quests + periodic “boss challenges”, and an optional private/friends leaderboard implemented without real-time features.

Implement an anti-cheating system: detect suspicious completion patterns (e.g., repeated instant completions, identical proof text, excessive streak-saving behavior), reduce rewards for flagged events, require stronger evidence when suspicion is high, and show gentle honesty prompts.

Provide “AI suggestions based on habits” and “AI encouragement messages” without external LLM services: implement a local rule-based insight engine that analyzes completion times, streaks, skips, and procrastination patterns to suggest optimal schedules, habit stacking opportunities, and personalized motivation style; generate encouragement messages from templated variants with personalization tokens.

Build onboarding and daily usage flows: initial onboarding collects goals, preferred reminder windows, motivation style, theme choice, and audio preferences; daily home screen shows today’s plan, due reminders, quests, progress charts, and quick actions.

Design and enforce a cohesive, fun-but-professional visual theme (not blue/purple by default): define color palette, typography, spacing, component styling, micro-interactions, and dark mode; apply consistently across all screens.

Add a full “design deliverables” section inside the app repository documentation: app structure (screens/flow), UI layout descriptions, color palette & fonts, sound/music style guide, mascot/character concept, icon/badge concepts, and animation concepts, written in English and detailed enough for another developer to implement consistently.

Redesign the app’s global visual theme to feel like a mobile game UI (dark, high-contrast, glossy cards, neon accents, soft gradients, and subtle depth), using the uploaded reference image as the primary style guide, and apply it consistently across all pages and dialogs.

Update global styling tokens (CSS variables / Tailwind theme usage) to support the reference-style dark UI: define a dark-first palette with purple/magenta accents, improved card elevation, borders, and glow states; ensure primary/secondary/destructive/chart colors look consistent with the new game aesthetic.

Redesign the main layout (header + navigation + page container) into a game-like HUD: compact, stylized header; navigation that feels like a game menu; and a content area that uses stacked panels/cards similar to the reference image.

Redesign the Home page dashboard to match the reference image’s structure and hierarchy: player/profile panel, level/XP progress bar, streak panel, coin panel, and a prominent ‘Today’s Tasks’ section with a strong primary CTA.

Restyle task presentation components to match the game-like card style: TaskCard, task lists, and task actions should use compact badges, accent chips, and a bold primary action button similar to the reference design.

Enhance celebratory and progression UI to feel more game-like: restyle reward celebration overlays, progress bars, and badges to match the new aesthetic (glow, depth, and a ‘loot/reward’ feel) while keeping motion respectful of reduced-motion settings.
Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the UI where appropriate (do not serve images through the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create end-to-end Task Reminder System blueprint and build plan including smart reminders, completion proof/follow-ups, reward & gamification loops, anti-cheating, psychology-based motivation, design deliverables, and technical architecture (DB/API/algorithms/stack).

Implement backend persistence, API surface, and data structures in a single Motoko actor for: users, tasks, schedules, reminder events, completions (with proofs/reflections), rewards economy, quests, story progress, avatar state, anti-cheat telemetry, and settings.
Redesign the entire app UI to match a game-like style (based on the provided reference design), so it feels like a game rather than a website.
